metadata.title: CVE-2023-50868 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: The Closest Encloser Proof aspect of the DNS protocol (in RFC 5155 when RFC9276 guidance is skipped) allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (CPU consumption for SHA-1 computations) via DNSSEC responses in arandom subdomain attack, aka the "NSEC3" issue. The RFC 5155 specificationimplies that an algorithm must perform thousands of iterations of a hashfunction in certain situations.

criterions.comment: bind9: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
unbound: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
